oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Roy Acuff Grand Ole Opry Discs: Tape 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Roy Acuff's Prince Albert sponsored Grand Ole Opry. The tape is labeled Acuff's tape number five of an unidentified number. The tape features multiple recordings. The additional recordings are sponsored by American Ace Coffee. The recording features Grant Turner (host) and features performances by: Roy Acuff (musician), the Smokey Mountain Boys (musical group), Red Foley (musician), Rod Brasfield (comedian), Brothers Oswald (musical group), and the Pap's Jug Band (musical group). The tape is from a multitude of dates from: January 03, 1948; and January 31, 1948.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smokey Mountain Boys; Red Foley; Rod Brasfield; Brothers Oswald; Paps Jug Band
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Always Alone (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (02:12) Roy Acuff reads ""Pa's Straight Razor,"" a poem by Cottonseed Clark -- (05:56) I Saw the Light [featuring Red Foley introduction voiceover] (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (08:13) I'll Fly Away (Red Foley) -- (09:48) Waltz of the Wind (Roy Acuff) -- (12:13) Rod Brasfield performs a comedy routine -- (14:46) Roy Acuff reads ""Jim and Me,"" a poem by Cottonseed Clark -- (16:20) That Meeting in the Air [excerpt] (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (18:39) Fiddler's Dream ([Unidentified]) -- (19:43) Detour [skips] ([Unidentified]) -- (21:56) Life is Like a Mountain Railroad (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (24:51) Foggy Mountain Top (Brothers Oswald) -- (26:08) Where Could I Go but to the Lord (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (27:00) Shady Grove ([Unidentified]) -- (27:54) Missouri, I Hear You Calling Me (Pap's Jug Band) [features an unidentified Racheal] -- (29:58) Orange Blossom Special [skips] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Brasfield, Rod; Brasfield, Rod, 1910-1958; Oswald and Joe; Pap's Jug Band;
